etymologies: mid 18th century: from Latin decurrent- ‘running down’, from the verb decurrere

definitions: (of a fungus gill, leaf, etc.) extending down the stem below the point of attachment.
shortDefinitions: (of fungus gill, leaf, etc.) extending down stem below point of attachment

definitions: (of a shrub or the crown of a tree) having several roughly equal branches.
shortDefinitions: (of shrub or crown of tree) having several equal branches
